website_summaries.verdict: An affordable bedding option with minimal dust.
pros: This bedding expands up to 3-times its size for soft and fluffy bedding that works well for smaller pets
For the volume of bedding you get, this is one of the best values available
cons: Quality is inconsistent, ranging from fluffy white bedding to shredded paper-like strips

customer_reviews.title: Infested with parasitic lice
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. My poor guinea ended up infested with parasitic lice. Make sure to freeze for 24 to 48 hrs. When I purchased this during the winter months I didn't notice a problem, except for the fact that a different quality of shedding was sent to me each time. But once we got into the warmer months there was no time for the cold temps to kill of the lice, and I didn't know until my vet informed me about the parasites that can live and breed in this stuff at the warehouse. Never will I purchase this from amazon again
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Atherton

customer_reviews.title: They seem to have changed to a lower quality bedding.
customer_reviews.text: It seems they changed their paper. It used to be soft, fluffy, absorbent, and pretty low mess. Now it is like the cheap stringy paper litter that I was paying extra to avoid. It feels extremely low quality, it's not absorbent, it is stringy - like the messy shredded paper for gift bags, and gets everywhere. My rabbit has already kicked it out everywhere and cat dragged it in. I attached pictures of what the last bedding looked like and what this bedding looked like. Same packaging, three weeks apart. I'm so sad :(
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Mio

customer_reviews.title: Changed the bedding material
customer_reviews.text: So loved this bedding at first. It was the same soft fluffy consistency as carefresh for a way better price. Then all of a sudden they change the bedding to literally shredded paper. It sucks now. Terrible. Will be going back to carefresh.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Quality
customer_reviews.text: You never know what you're going to get when you order this product. Sometimes it's the soft, fluffy type. Sometimes it's the longer, shredded paper type. My hamsters seem to like the shredded paper type best because it's good for building elaborate tunnel and cave systems that don't collapse. They make lots of happy hamster squeaks when they work with it. However, there's absolutely no way to tell when you're ordering which type you'll end up with. I always order white because it's easy to see which areas need to be scooped out every day, so I don't know about the consistency of the other colors/types.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wendy D. Rakus

customer_reviews.title: Our guinni pigs feel comfy !
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cute guinni pigs named Bubbles and Daisy. We were purchasing their bedding at pet stores and it's quite expensive. I looked on Amazon and they sell the same exact bedding at a much lower cost. They make the bedding with all natural paper. It expands twice the size. It's fluffy and cushiony for them,and it's safe ! When we put it in their cage, their isn't any dust. They enjoy playing and digging in it. I'm happy with this product !
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: go-to substrate for hamster
customer_reviews.text: Great substrate. Absorbs most smell - when it does, it's time to change. Product itself doesn't have smell. My Syrian hamster loves just digging around in the fluff and doesn't seem to mind it at all. This is also his primary and preferred bedding. The only con is that it will get onto clothes and work itself into carpet UPDATE: 09/26/2017 they changed the formulation for the bedding, now it comes out crinkly like shredded paper instead of fluffy. My hamster doesn't appreciate it and sleeps on top of the bedding now instead of making a den inside of it
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Like shredded tissue paper, product changed to cheap material
customer_reviews.text: I used to love this product for my guinea pig because it used to be soft and absorbent, not anymore. Now instead of fluffy bedding it is like tiny bits of thin, shredded tissue paper that does not fluff up and collapses when she walks on it. It is not absorbent at all, when my piggy pees on it, it becomes a soggy wet mess that is hard to scoop. Her cage smells like a farm when I use this bedding because it does not spot clean well and sticks to the bottom of the cage when wet. Don't waste your money on this, their are plenty of better products out there that work way better.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Peck

customer_reviews.title: Something has changed - I will not buy online anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what happened, but this bedding doesn't even compare to what was normally sold in the exact same package! This is thin, shredded garbage which STINKS as soon as our bunny touches it. It does not expand at all!!! It mats down in a mess if it gets slightly wet. I HATE THIS! I have purchased this product before, same brand, same type, etc. I love the original (or real) product. Is this a knock-off that's well-packaged?
customer_reviews.author: Rancho Customer

customer_reviews.title: Killed my hamster- do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this Kaytee brand bedding! It’s just dusty, shredded paper and NOT the soft, fluffy bedding that they advertise it to be. My hamster was perfectly healthy until I put this crap in her cages. She developed a respiratory illness after living in this bedding for a few days. I took her to the vet and she passed away a couple days later.
customer_reviews.author: schuyler buckley

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!
customer_reviews.text: I am unsure if this product would be better for a different type of animal, but I wouldn’t recommend it for rabbits. I still have half a package in my pantry, because I didn’t want to use the rest! It says that it helps with odors, but I think it actually made them worse! I was cleaning out the dirty stuff at least once a day, and it still stunk! I have never had any problems with this brand and their Timothy hay, but this bedding was a bust for us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and so dusty!
customer_reviews.text: This product is supposed to be 99% dust free but it is terribly dusty and causing my rats to sneeze and wheeze. Rats are already prone to respiratory infections, so this product is terrible for them. It tears apart like toilet paper and creates lots of dusty particles in the air. It even caused the rest of the family to start sneezing. You can even see the white particles flying around in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon U

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Cozy Original.
customer_reviews.text: Clean & Cozy Original is what I use in my Robo Dwarf's tank. She absolutely loves this stuff. It's so soft and fluffy and she loves burrowing in it. I had been using the carefresh but switched to this because it was a better deal. It's my first time using a Kaytee bedding but I am very happy with it. I'm surprised I like it more than the carefresh but it's so much softer (sometimes carefresh gets these hard pieces, and she wouldn't burrow in it as much). I don't know how well it is at keeping odors away as my little ham doesn't smell ever but I will be buying more of it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Felscream

customer_reviews.title: Consistency Changed — for the worse
customer_reviews.text: This used to be our go-to hamster bedding. Until they changed it. The last two orders (we were subscribed) haven’t been fluffy or soft. They’re like scratchy shredded cheap paper. Our hamster’s cage (which is huge) starts to stink almost immediately bc the stuff is so thin. If anyone knows a better option, I’m in the market for new bedding.
customer_reviews.author: FearsomeKitty

customer_reviews.title: Changed! Not the Same!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Kaytee brand bedding for my guinea pigs; it was much more absorbent and softer than the Care Fresh brand. Unfortunately this last time it was not the same as before. It was essentially just shredded paper, as several other reviewers have noted. I’m not sure what to do, as I don’t want to buy Care Fresh, but if all of the bedding has changed to this shredded paper consistency, then I’ll have to change brands. Hopefully Kaytee realizes what a mistake this was, and what an even bigger mistake it was to not advertise that they changed this.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Affordable hamster cage bedding.
customer_reviews.text: These come compacted when packaged and expands when you take it out of the packaging. I like that the color is white so I can easily detect when it’s time to change my hamster’s bedding. I have a winter white hamster so it does mimic the snow color that I’m sure she was used to. After awhile in the cage it does get compacted again if you have an active hamster. Overall I am very satisfied with this bedding and have subscribed to a monthly delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Fun2have2

customer_reviews.title: Gross! Poor quality control?
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t the first time I’ve ordered this product from amazon, but it’s the first time I’ve experienced ordering this product and getting very sub-par quality. Upon arrival, I could clearly see that the bedding was not the usual stark white color it normally is. I tried to brush that off as just a variance in paper color. However, when I opened the package, I noticed a very foul odor and huge chunks of discolored (beige-y) bedding. When I dug in a little further, I found a piece of black plastic. The bedding also felt really rough. It’s clearly contaminated. Something is wrong with this and I would not trust it to be in contact with any of my animals.
customer_reviews.author: loveadict44

customer_reviews.title: This bedding has mites!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bedding and used it one time in my hamster tank. My hamster is over 2 years old and has always been healthy. Within a couple days of him being in this new bedding he started itching. It got a lot worse where he quickly started losing his fur in places. I had to take him to the vet to get medicated which cost me over $50. She even informed me that this brand of bedding is known for having mites! She recommended Oxbow brand, it is more expensive, but worth it in the long run to avoid your little fella getting sick or mites!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: No others can compare!
customer_reviews.text: After trying to save a few bucks buy buying other brands, I've learned that THIS is THE BEST bedding. Period. Other retail brands do NOT measure up when it comes to odor absorbency which is highly important to me! This bedding hides odors very well and also is SUPER absorbent, like a sponge! I also feel like i don't have to worry when my bunny eats it, compared to another kind i bought in the past that was colored; ingesting a bunch of dyed paper CAN'T be healthy!... I Will ALWAYS stick with this Kaytee bedding!
customer_reviews.author: Senia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bedding!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! Lasts twice, if not three times as long as aspen shavings. If your worried about mites, just put in freezer for a minimum of 24hrs and it will kill them. I do this with all my pet bedding, regardless of type, and never had a problem. Just be sure to let bedding go back to room temp before placing in pet’s enclosure. Cold bedding could send them into shock.
customer_reviews.author: rtlueckTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's a weird mixed batch
customer_reviews.text: I buy this all the time to avoid the weird coloured versions in case my bunny eats any. I avoid the natural/brown coloured ones because it leaves weird texture and my bunny doesn't like it that much. Usually it's all white, but this particular bag is a mix of white and weird beige colour... what's the deal? Not sure how obvious it is but the bag on the left is all white and on the right is mixed. and it's not just a little mixed but the entire bag is. It's probably nothing, but these things aren't cheap for the fact that it's shredded paper.
customer_reviews.author: K00

customer_reviews.title: SO UPSET WITH THIS BRAND
customer_reviews.text: I had the same problem as MANY of these reviews below. The first time I purchased this my hamster baby loved it. I have never seen her play with her bedding as much and make so many tunnels. It was great and the price compared to other brands, even better. I was so happy I had finally found her perfect bedding, as I have tried many brands to find it. The second time I purchased, it was like the scratchy paper shreds!! I am very disappointed. This just sucks since I loved this bedding, but I won't risk purchasing again to get the wrong one. This is going to lose them many customers.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Very compacted, fluffs up well
customer_reviews.text: Like the package says, this is very compacted. We use only a segment each time we clean the very large hamster cage that we have. We fill about three or four inches in a cage that is two by three feet. I'm not sure how this compares as far as scent absorption. The hamster cage almost always smells terrible, but this is the only bedding that we've ever used because it's the first we tried and it has been excellent as far as fluffiness and price. We've bought it at least several times and felt no need to try anything else.
customer_reviews.author: MBM

customer_reviews.title: Best I've tried, & only one of two safe beddings for hamsters
customer_reviews.text: Unscented paper-based and aspen are the ONLY safe beddings for hamsters--pine, cedar, and scented beddings cause respiratory problems, and cotton can tangle around and cut off limbs and will cause intestinal blockages/death if consumed. This bedding is soft and has no scent. It's very compressed and fluffs up to 2-3 times its size when taken out. Very absorbent, and if your cage is above the BARE MINIMUM recommended 450 sq inches for hamsters, you'll only need to change it in full about once a month, with spot-cleaning in between. The worst I've gotten is a slightly "dusty" batch, but that mostly stays at the bottom of the bag. I've never been disappointed by this bedding. Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Windham

customer_reviews.title: Great for our sensitive hamster
customer_reviews.text: I love this bedding for my teddy bear hamster, Carrot. She had a really hard time adjusting to certain bedding, as we had to try several brands and types because she was constantly itching and sneezing. However, this bedding worked really well for her and she no longer itches or sneezes constantly like she used to. It's fluffy, it absorbs well, there's no scent to it, it seems to last awhile, and c'mon it's $13! we were paying over $20 for other crappy bedding! We order it once a month now and couldn't be happier with the quality and the price.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Caution plz read! For the safety of your hammies
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a problem with this before have used this product for years. That being said I just cleaned my hamsters cages and was opening this and putting it in their cages when thank god I noticed strings of black I don't know what thick something and hard lumps of what seems to be rubber I took photos and tossed the rest I'm going to let amazon know so the seller/ company can be alerted. Most Definitely there should be a recall. God forbid one of my jammies would've ingested that crap. They need to recall this is a hazard for jammies and could be deadly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Kitty Kat ^,,^

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing about this paper is the price
customer_reviews.text: This paper is awful. I've had mice for years and I've never used paper this bad. There's a bunch of hard pieces that I don't feel comfortable putting in their tank so I have to pick out those bits. The paper itself just seems like shredded toilet paper or something. It's not very absorbent and it doesn't cover smells at all. It's also a bit dusty. I've had to start changing their tank much more often in order to make up for how terrible this paper is. After using half the bag, I've decided to switch back to Carefresh. It's more expensive but I just can't keep using this terrible paper on my girls.
customer_reviews.author: Ki

customer_reviews.title: Quality varies, but they will refund if you get a bad batch usually.
customer_reviews.text: The quality varies I've noticed. Of the 5 times I've bought off amazon I recieved the bad quality bedding twice. The first time I got refunded as it was like the Easter egg stuff in baskets, the second time it is what's shown on right side of image(left is the good or normal quality). It was usable, but definitely doesn't have the same softness or bounce. Overall I'm happy with the product, but they really need to keep their product consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bedding I’ve bought hands down
customer_reviews.text: This is a super fluffy bedding for your little fur baby. My hammy loves it. It doesn’t smell. I do recommend to let the powder settle for a few before putting the lil fur baby in the bedding to roam around. Buying only this bedding and nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Otero

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan anymore.
customer_reviews.text: The first two times I bought this stuff I had no issues. The bedding was a very dry paper, almost like confetti or something, and indeed like the label states: 99% dust-free. I've purchased several more since then and every one of them has been soft, like recycled tissue or toilet paper, and consequently dust-ridden. I don't know what it is they changed or why, but dust is terrible for little critter's respiratory tracts - especially ones that burrow. I've also noticed a pretty awful chemical smell with the last few as well. It smells strong to me, so I can't imagine what it does to my hedgehog :/ I'm going to try Carefresh next.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: Worst bedding ever!
customer_reviews.text: We normally buy the brown shredded stuff from the pet store and I saw all the great reviews on this stuff, so I bought a bag. Horrible decision! It matted down, had a bad odor, and made the guinea pig cage stink. I thought maybe it was user error, but after the 3rd bedding change, I knew it was the product and not us. We are back to the brown shredded stuff and there's no more guinea pig cage stink. YAY! 1 star, do not recommend. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff because it's all natural and no horrible pine scents that are bad for your pets!
customer_reviews.text: We've used this stuff for a few years now and can't rave enough about it. It absorbs great and is all natural and non toxic, etc.. So if some of it gets eaten by any of your animals, no big deal. So much better than the scented pine shavings which are bad for your pets and a lot less comfortable for their soft feet. This bedding is just fantastic! Not much more to say! It doesn't mask or cover any smells, you still have to keep their bedding changed.. But we change ours every so often and never smell our gerbils so it works and does what it should!
customer_reviews.author: Mountain ManTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE buy this for your small pets!
customer_reviews.text: I have two pet rats and I have used this stuff for years. They love it. Do not go with sawdust or chippings, it is uncomfortable for them. My rats like to push this around and bed with it and can sleep in their box on it if they desire (They also have a seperate bedding area on a different level) It is inexpensive, easy to clean, and expands so you get a lot of use out of a small amount, and the odor absorbency is great. BUY THIS for your small pets! They will thank you
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE Do not BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product and loved it because it was just paper. They MUST have changed the formula because sometimes my hamster dumps her water out from her dish. I noticed there was an adsorbent along with the bedding. Like the one you find in baby diapers. (I also have a chemistry background) This is not safe for her since she sometimes likes to fill her cheeks with the bedding and eats it too. I am very upset and am looking to buy a new product!! I want to warn others in order not to buy this because of your pets safety.
customer_reviews.author: Thanh

customer_reviews.title: Poor odor control
customer_reviews.text: We were using the Care Fresh bedding and I got this because it seemed to be a better deal so I decided to give it a try. I’m not a huge fan of this bedding compared to the Care Fresh. It doesn’t seem to help with odor control at all. In the description, it says that it expands once pulled out of the package and it does, but my personal preference is for one a little less “fluffy”. The other kind was a bit more compact and didn’t overtake the whole cage. Doubt I’ll be buying this kind again.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and does everything they say it does.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying this product for several years now. We have 3 guinea pigs and 3 gerbils. This stuff is great. While I buy the white primarily, I’ll also buy the lavender when it’s on sale. I’ve had no issues with this product and the quality is consistent. I’ll buy 2-3 at a time to simply stock up. It expands well, holds moisture, Isn’t dusty, etc. I’ve noticed that several other reviewers have commented on the lack of consistency and other issues, I have had no such problems and would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: R. Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Not all that great.
customer_reviews.text: These shreds are just not very good. The cardboard colored shreds are way better. For whatever reason, it doesn't absorb urine odor well so you end up with an odd smell within 24 hours. I only got this because you don't have the cardboard colored one available in the big pack. Big mistake. I'm getting two of a smaller cardboard colored. Kaytee stuff is always good, except this. Plus, I find sharp pieces that could hurt my bunnies paws. Be aware!
customer_reviews.author: hellomynameis

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent quality and not dust free
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other reviews on this page. The quality is very inconsistent. Sometimes it’s so soft and fluffy and other times it’s coarse and papery. I’m not sure what they mean by expands 3x because, if anything, it gets compacted once my hamster starts to move around and step on it. Also, it’s not dust free. It gets everywhere for me. I always have to hold my breath when I change the bedding because it will literally give me an asthma attack.
customer_reviews.author: Rin

customer_reviews.title: Really works great and you get a lot
customer_reviews.text: I had a really hard time choosing the right bedding but this stuff gave us a lot. We have a very large habitat for our hamster that consists of a shelf and a traditional cage on top and needed a lot of good bedding that didn't need to be completely cleaned out every few days. We scoop out the dirty parts and this stuff is nice and absorbent and does not smell bad. Great product. Used this package in two turns over about a month for her very large cage.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Nebula Family

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! When it says that it expands up 3x
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! When it says that it expands up 3x, it means it. I have a 55 gallon long tank = a lot of bedding needed! As any pet owner knows, bedding adds up quickly. I love how this fills my tank up 2/3 of the way without any extra needed, though I add aspen or kilt dried pine (sold by Kaytee) for added odor control. White isn't my favorite color because you can see droppings/wee easier, however it gives you the best deal on the price. It does help to keep things cleaner...no one wants to see droppings! My hammy approves 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Hayataka

customer_reviews.title: It's a Gamble
customer_reviews.text: I regularly order this product for my guinea pig and rabbit cages, but lately I never know what I'm really going to get. Sometimes, it's thick paper bedding that actually serves its purpose and is reasonably absorbent. Others, it's basically thinly shredded tissue paper. The thin bedding is an infuriating rip-off, and there's no way to know what you're going to get.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G.

customer_reviews.title: This time quality was bad usually it’s good.
customer_reviews.text: This product normally is very good but my last order was not the normal soft fluffy stuff. It was more like shredded paper. This happened once before. I think the product control person lets some of the bad stuff get through now and then. I have been buying this for years now and have been very pleased. I hope my next order will be the nice soft absorbent bedding like it normally is.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful. It’s very lightweight and gets EVERYWHERE. Our bunny kicks it out of the cage. It has no odor control and is not very absorbent at all. We had to replace it before the whole package was used. Would never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: egghead23

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value for a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Carefresh is a fantastic small animal bedding, but I use it for some of my reptiles. It's fantastic for Corn Snakes and others who don't need particularly high amounts of humidity, and it's not as dusty as aspen bedding. It cuts down on scents effectively, too, and while this bag is pure white, the variety of colors that Carefresh comes in are always fun. I go through a ton of this stuff in my multi-pet household, so I definitely appreciate being able to get it in bulk sizing!
customer_reviews.author: Roxyana W,

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff for our stinky guinea pig
customer_reviews.text: I like this one the most. It seems to do a good job with odor control, even though guinea pigs are smelly in general. To make it easier to clean, I put scratch paper at the bottom of the tray, then the bedding. When we have clean the cage, I just pull at the paper underneath and it all comes out in a big chunk. I also don't have to scrub the poo anymore since it stays on the paper and comes out with the paper and bedding.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bern

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy, but dusty
customer_reviews.text: The Clean and Cozy is a personal favorite, but the bedding it's self is slightly dusty. My hamsters have never had a problem with it being a respiratory concern, but when I clean out my 100 gallon cage, there is a thin layer of dust on ALL of my surfaces. I like to take out all the bedding, clean the bottom, and then put all of the same bedding back in, since it isn't actually dirty. The bedding is super comfy and absorbent, and doesn't hold smell if you spot clean it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: kp

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I FOUND SHARP WOOD PIECES AND HARD PLASTIC PIECES IN THE LAST EIGHT BAGS OF BEDDING THAT I HAD PURCHASED OF THIS BRAND FROM THIS LISTING. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I TRIED PICKING THE PIECES OUT ONCE I NOTICED THE SHARP WOOD PIECES BUT SOME OF THE PIECES WEREN'T AS NOTICEABLE AND MY ONE HAMSTER GOT A CUT ON HER LITTLE TAIL. DO NOT BUY THIS BEDDING. EVERY BAG HAS A DIFFERENT TEXTURE TO IT AND THEN WITH FINDING HARMFUL PIECES IN IT, NEVER AGAIN WILL I BUY THIS ITEM, AND I ADVISE EVERYONE ELSE TO NOT BUY IT TOO.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright
customer_reviews.text: I got the 49l bag and it’s somewhat big. but the quality reminds me of shredded toilet paper. I used to use carefresh natural paper bedding but decided to switch because I couldn’t find a large bag of carefresh to use for a long time so I settled for kaytee clean and cozy. once I cut open the bag all the air released and I noticed the side was somewhat empty. The pieces are also very small and crumb like so be careful or you’ll have a lot of cleaning to do. It does the job just fine, but when I am done with the bag, I will definitely switch back to carefresh. Just a bit disappointed😔
customer_reviews.author: angelina

customer_reviews.title: Not a good package.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand I've used. And this particular item was different. Not sure if it's the merchant and that's why it's marked down. But I had some left over from the previous packaging and the color is different. The new item is not as white, there's pieces of objects in the bedding, the smell is funny. Nothing like I'm use to.
customer_reviews.author: Felisha Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my lil hammies
customer_reviews.text: I love this bedding. Both my hamsters (Russian Dwarf and a Robo, in separate cages) LOVE this bedding too! I never have any issues with smell, and if I do, its mostly because my boys are out running around I think. Otherwise, poop or pee smells have never permanently permeated through my room or in their cages. They LOVE burrowing in this stuff. It is super soft and wonderful. Feels like soft toilet paper. It is easy for them to dig around in but can also maintain a shape. In my robo's cage, there's a clear bottom, and I can see areas where he has dug little tunnels :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pisarsky

customer_reviews.title: Not like previous bag
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the same thing at local pet store and it was decent and expanded, this I received from amazon, I just opened and it’s just stands of paper not the chunks like the other bag we had this doesn’t expand at all! Idk what is with this bag! My daughter bought with her own money and it’s going in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brill

customer_reviews.title: Actual Trash- so disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought in the store and was so impressed: fluffy like toilet paper, expands incredibly, hardly any dust, very absorbent. Was so impressed that I went to buy it again and ordered it in amazon for convenience with coronavirus. SO SO disappointed! Felt like completely different product. Rough stringy shredded paper and actual trash (stickers and labels ) in the bedding. Rough and scratchy. One bag barely lasted two cages. Terribly dissatisfied and do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Eichelman

customer_reviews.title: The bedding inside the package is not what it is described
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the same Kaytee bedding for my hamster for 2 years. The order I received this time is horrible. The bedding is not as cozy and soft as it used to be. It's like shredded cheap and thin toilet paper. The brand, and package is the same as what I have been ordering, but the bedding inside is a totally different thing. I will not order this anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t repurchase
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t reorder this bedding. It’s kind of like trying to coat the bottom of your critters cage with down feathers; it isn’t odor absorbing, doesn’t really absorb much liquid and overall is just not very effective. It might work out better for a very small animal like a hamster, and it emits very little dust participles. It just didn’t work out for my 4 ferrets and I
customer_reviews.author: KonaKathie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Cavester Warm
customer_reviews.text: Hamster loves it. Makes his own little cave every single night. Little caveman aka cavester. I like it the texture of it for him bc it’s warmer BUT you can see the crap and the pee much quicker than with any other kind of bedding. Not sure if I will order again but will try to find something similar and in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Easy clean up, less soggy.
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. I have to use bedding like this at the moment for my piggies and it helps keep their cages soft and not wet like so many other brands I have used. I am waiting on making cage liners for them while I build their new cages, so they can be mesured to the right size. This stuff has really saved me. And it works really well for two months for my two little piggies. They get so excited to play in the white fluff.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great bedding!
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior hamster and he LOVES this bedding. It's super soft, but also really absorbent. I usually alternate between the white and brown; it just depends which one is cheaper when I need to stock up. I have guinea pigs too, but haven't used the white on them since I know their pellets will be way too obvious; however, I can recommend the brown bedding for pigs! You would't think it'd be obsorbant since it's so soft, but it really is. Highly recommend. :) Oh, and it expands a lot, so the package looks like it'll only last a couple cage cleans, but it lasts a decent amount of time!
customer_reviews.author: My Kids Have Fur, Feathers or Scales.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT control odor AT ALL.
customer_reviews.text: Because of great reviews this is the bedding I purchased when my daughter got guinea pigs for the first time. Our entire house smelled like a barn. I had her clean the entire cage every other day and still the Guinea pig cage and our entire house smelled BAD all the time like urine and poop. Then during COVID our shipment was delayed and we were out so I went to the local feed store and picked up the only small animal bedding product they carried which was also the Kaytee brand “aspen” bedding. I was amazed that there was NO ODOR !! We are now using that and changing the bedding only once or twice a week!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Haraden

customer_reviews.title: Bedding material has been CHANGED
customer_reviews.text: The user that showed the difference in bedding quality was completely correct. I remember buying this litter from here for the last couple of years and the last two batches have been completely off. I’m going to try one more time when my bag is running low but if I get the same quality I will be done. You have to put TWICE as much bedding as before and I don’t feel it absorbs the smell as good as it used to because of the change in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I try to refrain from any negative comments, but this is a true *buyer beware* due to the utter lack of function this product offers. It has zero absorbancy & immediately produces odor when any urine makes contact. I was so frustrated after just one use, that I trashed the entire bag (I wish I would’ve had demanded a refund, but I made a hasty decision by throwing it away too soon). I would never purchase this product again & highly discourage it even being produced & sold.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great product that our hamsters love!
customer_reviews.text: Our hamsters love this bedding! They are able to tunnel with it, it's healthier, looks better than some of the other bedding, and absorbs better. The only downside to this product is it does not mask the odor as much as wood chips, but the trade off for using a better and healthier product is well worth it. We go about 10 days with one hamster per tank. Only other word of advice is DO NOT use the dyed bedding. It is not healthy for the animals. Stick with the white :-)
customer_reviews.author: NHAlpine

customer_reviews.title: Fluff for small animal cages
customer_reviews.text: There's no scent to the clean bedding. It comes vacuum packed & kind of like a softer "brick." A person needs to break it up to make it usable in a small animal cage. It is an okay way to keep a small animal cage nice for the small animal.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Gilley

customer_reviews.title: Good in a Pinch but too much trouble
customer_reviews.text: It's very soft and seems pretty absorbant so I know it's comfortable for my Chin to get in and out of however it's more like shredded tissue than the usual chunky paper bedding at the pet store. It flies away very easily so I have to chase it down all the time. It's a lot of trouble for the value. I wouldn't purchase it again. It was an emergency purchase to make sure I had something on hand due to the hurricane.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Not Dust Free
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, this is a decently nice bedding and my rats love playing in it and it cleans up nicely, however it is a lot more dusty than they say it is... You can't see the dust when you hold it and play with it, but after my rats dig in it and they come up, there's a whole bunch of white dust all over their faces and they've been sneezing a little more than they should. Still love this bedding for the time being but I plan on switching to a different brand once my two bags run out.
customer_reviews.author: samantha bedard

customer_reviews.title: Changed the ingredients. Not safe.
customer_reviews.text: They've changed the formula/ingredients. Now it includes something like what absorbs in diapers. When it gets wet it turns into a gel like substance which can not be good for small animals. We used this for our hedgehog and it made clumps of gel between her quills when she got a bath and was difficult to completely clean from her habitat. It used to be shredded paper, plain and simple. You'd fluff it to expand and it would be perfect for about a week of use. This is no longer safe for our small animals.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Warning read please.
customer_reviews.text: The material like the other comments, it use to be a lot fluffier. It is a lot thinner now that stressed paper I would say. If you’re looking for the thicker Version, buy it from the store and not amazon. Sadly, I can’t give a review until I have used it longer but I will give an updated review soon.
customer_reviews.author: Armanda N

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fluffy
customer_reviews.text: This is a good brand of pet bedding. I have bought other brands which were dusty and hard. Kaytee bedding fluffs up nicely and is easy to scoop up when it is time to spot clean or when it is time to completely change the bedding. I gave it an average for scent since it does not actually have a scent other than paper.
customer_reviews.author: pet lover

customer_reviews.title: Good for Dwarf Hamster
customer_reviews.text: My hamster is picky for bedding - he likes fluffy and soft, so wood is out. We used to use shredded paper bedding, which he loves but too much dust was there. This bedding is soft and fluffy and he likes to make a hole and sleep on it. Minus one as it does not have any odor control. This bedding absorbs urine well compared to wood, but still you can smell it as same as a regular letter size paper.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Hardly any smell & super cozy
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few beddings that does not smell after a few uses. I also like that it’s super soft for my geriatric guinea pig. She loves to prance all over whenever I put it in her home. I’ve tried different types and brands, but this if both of our favorites. It also did well for the two guinea pig brothers I fostered.
customer_reviews.author: MomTeacherArtist

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing to say the least
customer_reviews.text: I never tried this type product before and now I remember why. IT STINKS!! LITERALLY!! My poor babys nose must have been burning it was so bad. My hamster is in a huge 100 quart bin, with a second 64qt story connected with tubing. There is no way it should stink like that. Ive used unscented natural wood chips and it works 100% better and last significantly LONGER than this crap. Im going back to old faithful!!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Its great uwu
customer_reviews.text: I always use this type of beding since it has less dust happening which is great for myself but also great for my lil' chubby old lady hamster. Absorbs her pee. But also starts to smell over time. I cant tell since I'm use to it, but my mom says it smells bad. Tge beding sometimes comes out either soft or a tad bit rough during the seasons. So you never know what batch you get until you open it. And it is worth the price, since you get 3 times more of the product. Due to the fact that it expands.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Different quality
customer_reviews.text: It's not the same quality as the smaller bag. I've bought the medium and largest bag of bedding from the is listing. I'm not sure if this is an older bag or if the kaytee company itself is making the bigger bag shredded so it fills the bag. The giant bag is not soft and is shredded. It looks like a bag of hashbrowns. It's of a different material. The smaller bags I've purchased were whiter, softer and not shredded. Two pictures of the giant bag and a picture of the medium bag contents.
customer_reviews.author: ashleyrg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hamster habitats. It is a more affordable price than the other product that I prefer. It is pretty comparable in quality and value as the one that I usually get, but the price is a good bit lower. Seems like it is not as good to make tunnels in as the other, but for something that is disposable, it is a good enough quality for the price. The hamsters like it fine.
customer_reviews.author: brendagal

customer_reviews.title: Probably the Softest Bedding
customer_reviews.text: If you need something really soft for your beloved guinea pig or hamster or rabbit, etc., this stuff really does the trick. I have been buying it for many years and my guinea pig Pika loves it. Very cuddly for small rodents. My guinea pig will always choose the side of the cage with this bedding in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jony Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Great Litter/Bedding
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is dust free, very soft as well and keeps the ratties litter box nicely. It is unscented (I chose unscented on purpose) but as long as you clean consistently you should have no odor problem. I used this as litter but if used as bedding it is soft and dust free so my rats have no problem with URI's. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ember

customer_reviews.title: white isn't the best
customer_reviews.text: This review is only for the color of the bedding - the white makes my little guy's litter box look worse than a colored bedding would.. I was embarrassed to have friends over and have them see his litter box when I used this. I love the Kaytee bedding but need it to be colored to help camouflage the litter box contents.
customer_reviews.author: BattleBornNV

customer_reviews.title: White is right
customer_reviews.text: I like this specific type bc it's white and I can monitor the color of the urine from my rabbit. He is notorious for not drinking and only getting his fluids thru his greens so i worry about his kidneys and bladder. Sometimes it can be very dark in color that can lead to sickness. So this works perfectly and helps me to sneak in other ways to get him more fluids
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for your pet!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful don't buy it. I ordered this for my hedgehog because it said it was paper but it didn't specify that it was shredded toilet paper not the same. which is getting lint every where and is covering my hedgehog's nose/mouth so nothing about this product is safe for small animal's and I'm very upset right now I will not be ordering from this company again after this.
customer_reviews.author: Shenandoah taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not for my guineas...
customer_reviews.text: Used to be good bedding but for a while I have been finding pieces of plastic, wrappings, colored wax paper, etc. If my guineas would eat some of these foreig materials could die. I contacted Kaytee but the quality issue continues. My guineas keep sneezing with this bedding. It is not very absorbent either.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: Hamster loved!
customer_reviews.text: My Syrian hamster LOVED this bedding! It’s the perfect amount for a reasonable price. It’s white so I’ll know when it’s getting time to change it. As soon as she saw her new bedding she began burrowing in it. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gerbils aren't picky about bedding
customer_reviews.text: This is a little different material than what was labeled the same thing in another bag, but for a SIGNIFICANT price break it was worth it! (It seems lighter or something. Hard to describe the difference) The gerbils don't seem to be worried, I mean, they are gerbils. They take baths in dust for goodness sake. They would be digging holes underground if not for being trapped in a cage. Pretty sure they do not care if this bedding is "Less fluffy" It is still pretty fluffy!!! They stink no matter what kind of bedding you use, and I can't tell an oder difference. This stuff does the job just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Sym

customer_reviews.title: good price!
customer_reviews.text: This bedding did not come as some other reviewers were suggesting. This bedding was fluffy and expanded as I expected. I got the 24.6 L size for my hamster and expect it to last for about 3-4 bedding changes. The bedding did not mask the odor really but if you keep up with cleaning the cage, then that shouldn't be a problem. I would recommend getting your bedding in person at a pet store to get a closer look at what you're buying, that is what I plan on doing from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Alana Friend

customer_reviews.title: Dustier than I remember...
customer_reviews.text: I got another hamster recently after my last on passed a year ago, and I don't remember this stuff being so dusty. I lined my hamster's bin cage with this stuff, and after 10 minutes of crawling around, my hamster was covered in dust and lint from this litter. It's really disappointing because that's part of the reason why I buy this kind.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Great paper bedding, do not use pine or treated wood bedding for pets!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my hamster and mice for a year and love it. It's super absorbent and expands nicely. Please look up the dangers of using pine or other treated wood bedding for pets. Those beddings are toxic. This paper bedding works great, is safe, and is what I would recommend for small pets
customer_reviews.author: Lucas McLaird

customer_reviews.title: Great for guinea pigs if you can’t do fleece!
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our guinea pigs. Absorbs odor pretty well, and the pigs seem to like it. I line their cage with puppy pads (love the Costco brand the best) and then put a thick layer of this bedding on top. When it’s time to clean out the cage I just roll up the puppy pads like a Swiss roll, then slide the entire thing into a garbage bag. Pretty quick and easy! (Never had an issue with the pigs chewing or messing with the puppy pads, by the way.)
customer_reviews.author: Amy K. Amos

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to pine pellets!
customer_reviews.text: Used to use untreated pine pellets meant for use in horse stables. Would get 50 pounds for $8 but even with a dwarf rabbit we had to use a lot to absorb smell and waste. This item - the invented and uncolored one with no colored bits - lasts through about 4 litter box changes with no smell or dust, plus the litter box isn't too heavy and all of it is easy to compost. It's a little bit more expensive than the pine pellets and I feel silly having it delivered, but it works. Our bunny does not seem to be eating it - we pile a layer of hay for eating over the litter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 99.9% dust free my @&*
customer_reviews.text: It's not 99.9% dust free. Its about as dust free as fluffy toilet paper. I put an entire bag into a deep box for my rabbits to have a digging area. Everytime they use it their entire face are covered in dust. They get big white dust eye goop in their eyes because it gets in their eyes. How can they call it dust free?
customer_reviews.author: Heatherlynn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We used to buy carefresh and although they send out coupons and it was cheap it wasn't comfortable for my syrian. I want what is best for my girl so I tried this after hearing others loving it. My girl loves it! It is more expensive but it lasts longer as well! It doesn't smell as bad either. My girl loves to barry in this. She did the same with the carefresh but you can tell this is more comfortable for her. She had a hide house she slept in more than the bedding before using carefresh now she uses the bedding and hides in it like she is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as individual packs.  Just shredded paper towels
customer_reviews.text: Definitely just paper towels shredded.. I got the individual packs that come in the trays, and they are the same cloth like material you get with Clorox wipes. But this bag, 100% just paper towels. Not the same material and definitely not 99.9% dust free or whatever they claim.
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good bedding for hamster
customer_reviews.text: My little girl's Syrian usually doesn't use bedding for a bathroom... He uses a sand dish, so she said she's not sure how much it soaks up. Also, it doesn't tend to stink... The sand, however, is a different story. She says this bedding is soft and cheap, so she likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Thinny J

customer_reviews.title: Sticks to cage more than Carefree natural bedding
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using Carefresh custom rabbit / guinea pig pet bedding (natural color), but tried this Kaytee white bedding in my 3- level guinea pig cage because it seemed less expensive. However, this white bedding is harder to clean out of the cage when it gets wet with piggie pee because it sticks to the cage. I have now gone back to using the Carefresh natural bedding, even if it is a bit more expensive. Both types keep the cage smelling fresh, not piggie.
customer_reviews.author: ttmadison

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: According to my vet, whom we are now seeing weekly, this product almost certainly gave my guinea pig a mite infestation which we are still fighting. She's been to the vet several times and has had mu;tiple medications. Worst of all, she is obviously suffering. Stay away. I have switched to fleece bedding so this never, ever happens again.
customer_reviews.author: EFGuth

customer_reviews.title: My guineas snuggle in this stuff!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My guinea pigs seem to love this more than the Carefresh. They snuggle down into this softer bedding right after it is changed out. It is absorbent and, although it may be a bit more messy, my piggies love it and the hay they use is already more messy than this, so it doesn't really add any more time to cleaning/maintaining their cages. Note: Guinea pigs are VERY sensitive to smells. I would not recommend any type of scented bedding. Stick with the basic bedding, and they will thrive more.
customer_reviews.author: Wanpakumono

customer_reviews.title: Packaging Underestimates Product!
customer_reviews.text: I found this durning a sale, and decided to try it. I’m glad I did as it worked out great! It’s soft, and does “multiply”. Half of this this bag supplies enough bedding for an around 5ft width and 1 1/2 ft length cage! The package underestimates how much you get. This is just what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda J Lathrop

customer_reviews.title: Only for the smallest of small animals!
customer_reviews.text: Would probably be fine for a mouse or rat-sized critter, but with anything larger than that, use a different substrate. This stuff is basically tissue paper and you'll find yourself having to change the litter box every day, if not more than that! And I'm speaking from experience- with a very small (less than 3lb) rabbit. I can't imagine what you'd go through with a standard sized bun!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: My hamsters love burrowing in this!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! My hamsters love burrowing more now than ever before! It's so much better than Carefresh, Please never buy Carefresh. In the photos you can see the white Kaytee Clean and Cozy mixed in with their old bedding Carefresh. Carefresh is hard and mixed in with twigs, and Kaytee Clean and cozy is soft, almost like its made out of toilet paper. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Moore Family

customer_reviews.title: My rats got mites from this, even after freezing ...
customer_reviews.text: My rats got mites from this, even after freezing it in a sub zero freezer for over 48 hours. It's probably just the nature of a packed paper-based bedding. i noticed that right out of the freezer, this bedding isn't very cold, so I don't think cold is penetrating where it should. I've switched instead to walnut shell pellet cat litter.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Great Bedding
customer_reviews.text: I’very used this bedding for hamsters, rabbits, mice, and guinea pigs and it works great for all of them! I like that it’s very soft and the animals can dig around in it. It’s also cheaper than some other paper based beddings. It controls odor fairly well as long as you change it regularly. It’s also nice that it’s white so you can see when it’s dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this for your pet! I got this bedding and although it looks nice in the cage, its incredibly dusty and made my guinea pigs start sneezing! It caused me an $80 vet bill and I had to completely remove the bedding and immediately change to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great For Older Rats
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this since my rats were older in age, hoping itll be more gentle for them before they passed. It worked great! Much better than the woody type beddings. Its compressed so a lot more is in the package than you may think. No dust or hard, sharp chips inside. Its soft. My rats loved burying themselves and making hiding spots with this bedding. It handled well and did not smell up the house either rat odors.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any small animals cage!! My ferret approves!!
customer_reviews.text: CAN'T BELIEVED I'VE BEEN SPENDING OVER 20$ FOR THE SAME ANOUNT OF PADDING!!!! I'm so happy I found this!! I will NEVER buy my padding in store again! Not only that, it arrived same day (prime) when I needed it !!! My ferret was so happy running around in it and pushing her face in it ! She approves !!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Evick

product_meta.title: Kaytee Clean & Cozy White Small Animal Bedding
product_meta.description: Style:White| Size:49.2 LitersKaytee Clean & Cozy White small pet paper bedding gives you a whole new standard in super-soft, absorbent bedding. Clean & Cozy is soft and fluffy to encourage burrowing or nesting while absorbing 6x its weight in liquid. Clean & Cozy's absorbency means less odor. That's why Clean & Cozy has an odor control guarantee. Plus Clean & Cozy is 99% dust free for a cleaner cage.
feature_bullets: Clean and cozy bedding is safe for small pet including rabbits, hamsters, guinea pigs, chinchillas, and gerbils
Made of material that meets FDA standards

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
